text: <@U04DVL5T2TE> Hmm, didn’t know that the `.js` is the future. Yep, prob should convert to `nodenext` then. Anyway can’t do it now, there are loads of files in the library.
btw, what is the recommended `.tsconfig` for the HS?
Maybe you could add a small typescript section to the documentation?
:wave: - Thanks for letting us know <@U03RVAH50TY> . Looking into modern yarn use case. For now I would recommend running with `npm` if possible.

Yes, we need some typescript docs & examples. We were hesitant to start the private beta with two copies of our example repo (one regular JS and one TS) so we didn’t have to keep them in sync while we were potentially changing several things.

But from this early feedback, it seems like our early adopters are much more likely to use/want TS. I’ll talk to the team about porting our hello world to TS (and then later creating a JS version?)

Ok. Maybe there were two issues here (one around directory spaces and other windows path one) and our new release only fixed one of them. We will work on getting a windows VM going so we can fully replicate and fix. I don’t want us to force you to keep on retrying our “spray and pray” fixes :grimacing: :laughing:
one other option i didn’t consider yesterday - is it possible to (for now) test outside of the monorepo context to limit the effects of that `moduleResolution` change on the other packages?
<@U04DVL5T2TE> Yes, thought that also yesterday :grin:, I will try it out.
but anyway, <@UCY83QS6Q> and the other crew. Thanks for this amazing HS update. We had a meeting last spring and you did delivered more than I could have ever imagined!
